title: Latitude Financial IPO fixed at $2 ahead of bookbuild
text:
Latitude Financial Group's owners have fixed the company's proposed initial public offering at $2 a share, which is the bottom of the advertised price range.

The decision was made ahead of a bookbuild to price the float next week.

The offer size and structure is as per the company's prospectus, which was lodged last month.

Latitude Financial Group, headed by Ahmed Fahour, will seek to raise $1.24 billion for its IPO. A bookbuild is scheduled for next week. Nine

Latitude's brokers told fund managers of the decision at lunchtime on Friday.

The book message said: "Based on investor feedback to date, the price for the Latitude Financial Group IPO has been fixed at $2.00 per share / 12.4x PE / 5.2% dividend yield."
description: Latitude Financial Group's owners have fixed the company's proposed initial public offering at $2 a share, which is the bottom of the advertised price range.
